If you see any response, you can look in /var/log/nova/nova-manage.log to see the problem. No response means the command completed correctly and your nova database is now populated.

note.title: Deprecation warnings
note.para: Note that if while running this command you see warnings such as SADeprecationWarning: The 'listeners' argument to Pool (and create_engine()) is deprecated. Use event.listen()., these will be fixed in future version of the libraries and can be safely ignored.

section.para: Restart all services in total, just to cover the entire spectrum. On the controller node run:

para.screen: sudo start nova-api sudo start nova-conductor sudo start nova-network sudo start nova-scheduler sudo start nova-novncproxy sudo start libvirt-bin sudo /etc/init.d/rabbitmq-server restart

screen.userinput: for svc in api objectstore conductor network volume scheduler cert; do sudo service openstack-nova-$svc start; done

para.screen: sudo start nova-compute sudo start nova-network

screen.userinput: for svc in compute network; do sudo service openstack-nova-$svc start; done

section.para: All nova services are now installed and started. If the "start" command doesn't work, your services may not be running correctly (or not at all). Review the logs in /var/log/nova to look for clues.
